data.name: Merged header cells trouble
data.description:
For parsing of spreadsheet files we are using very basic library. This library reads the file and returns object with addresses as keys and values as values. For merged cells, library returns address of top left sub-cell. For example following table:
name date country
first last start end
would be parsed to: ```javascript { 'A1': 'name', 'C1': 'date', 'E1': 'country', 'A2': 'first', 'B2': 'last', 'C2': 'start', 'D2': 'end' } ``` For further processing we require "flatten" headers in form of one-dimensional array of column names. Column name is created by prefixing second row value with first row value (if present). ```javascript [ 'first name', 'last name', 'start date', 'end date', 'country' ] ``` For the purpose of this task, you can presume there will always be two rows and there will never be empty cell. Also there will only be columns addressed from A to Z (so no AA, AB etc.). Your task is to write function `flatten` that will process parsed cells array into flattened column names array. --- One more example
id price sold name address phone
base vat total first last home email mobile home work
```javascript { 'A1': 'id', 'B1': 'price', 'E1': 'sold', 'F1': 'name', 'H1': 'address', 'J1': 'phone', 'B2': 'base', 'C2': 'vat', 'D2': 'total', 'F2': 'first', 'G2': 'last', 'H2': 'home', 'I2': 'email', 'J2': 'mobile', 'K2': 'home', 'L2': 'work' } ``` would result in ```javascript [ 'id', 'base price', 'vat price', 'total price', 'sold', 'first name', 'last name', 'home address', 'email address', 'mobile phone', 'home phone', 'work phone', ] ```
